column4: Hi, How can I install apache with all modules, including php?
give me a sec

apt-get install apache2 apache2-doc apache2-mpm-prefork apache2-utils libexpat1 ssl-cert libapache2-mod-php5 php5 php5-common php5-curl php5-dev php5-gd php-pear php5-mhash php5-mysql php5-pspell php5-recode php5-snmp php5-sqlite php5-tidy php5-xmlrpc php5-xsl
for the modules, use a2enmod *module name*
it will usually be php5-*module name*
how are you trying to run the scripts?
you are going to have to change the php conf file. hold on a sec
change the extension of that file to .php
the php file that you are trying to execute
can you create a file called test.php and add this line to it: <PHP phpinfo() ?>
sorry, my mistake: <html><head><title>PHP test</title></head><body><?PHP phpinfo ?></body></html>
linky?
try this: a2enmod php5
see above
can you put your apache error log in a pastebin somewhere?
sudo apt-get install php5
can you copy your apache error log file to a pastebin please?
the apache log file is located here: /var/log/apache2/error.log and the pastebin service is here: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/
